greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Prime corresponding to largest prime power factor of n, a(1)=1.
comment: Most significant prime factor of n: If n = (p_1^e_1)(p_2^e_2)(p_3^e_3)... and max(p_1^e_1,p_2^e_2,...) = p_k^e_k then a(n) = p_k.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
mathematica: f[n_] := Sort[ {#[[1]]^#[[2]], #[[1]]} & /@ FactorInteger@ n][[ -1, 2]]; Array[f, 85] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Nov 05 2007 *)
program: (PARI) A088387(n) = if(1==n,1,my(f=factor(n),p=0); isprimepower(vecmax(vector(#f[, 1], i, f[i, 1]^f[i, 2])),&p); (p)); \\ _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 22 2018
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Sep 28 2003
ext: Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_ at the suggestion of _Stefan Steinerberger_, Nov 04 2007
